text: Staphylococcal enterotoxins modulate interleukin 2 receptor expression and ligand - induced tyrosine phosphorylation of the <extra_id_0> Janus protein-tyrosine kinase 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> Jak3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and signal transducers and activators of transcription ( Stat proteins ) .

Staphylococcal enterotoxins ( SE ) stimulate T cells expressing the appropriate variable region beta chain of ( V beta ) T-cell receptors and have been implicated in the pathogenesis of several autoimmune diseases .
Depending on costimulatory signals , SE induce either proliferation or anergy in T cells .
In addition , SE can induce an <extra_id_0> interleukin-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) nonresponsive state and apoptosis .

Here , we show that SE induce dynamic changes in the expression of and signal transduction through the <extra_id_0> IL-2 receptor (IL-2R) beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> gamma chains <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-2R beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-2R gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) in human antigen - specific <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T-cell lines .

Thus , after 4 hr of exposure to <extra_id_0> SEA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> SEB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , the expression of <extra_id_0> IL-2R beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was down-regulated , <extra_id_0> IL-2R gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was slightly up-regulated , while <extra_id_0> IL-2R alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> remained largely unaffected .

The changes in the composition of IL-2Rs were accompanied by inhibition of <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced tyrosine phosphorylation of the <extra_id_0> Janus protein-tyrosine kinase 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> Jak3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and signal transducers and activators of transcription called <extra_id_0> Stat3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Stat5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
In parallel experiments , <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - driven proliferation was inhibited significantly .

After 16 hr of exposure to SE , the expression of <extra_id_0> IL-2R beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> remained low , while that of <extra_id_0> IL2R alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL2R gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was further up-regulated , and ligand - induced tyrosine phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> Jak3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and Stat proteins was partly normalized .

Yet , <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - driven proliferation remained profoundly inhibited , suggesting that signaling events other than <extra_id_0> Jak3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / Stat activation had also been changed following SE stimulation .
In conclusion , our data suggest that SE can modulate IL-2R expression and signal transduction involving the Jak / Stat pathway in <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T-cell lines .
